result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William B. Franklin

defendant.name: Franklin, William B.
defendant.address: W3490 County Road HH, Warrens, WI 54666

records.addlTxt:
1:27 PM Defendant William B. Franklin appeared by video.  Attorney Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryan I Pierce appeared by video for William B. Franklin. State in compliance with all victims rights issues. Defendant understands and agrees to appear remotely.  Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 2 Misdemeanor Battery. Count 1 DRI. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea. Attorneys add on record the reasons for diversion agreement. Finding of guilt withheld. Bond continues.

JOINT SENTENCING RECOMMENDATION: Withhold Entry of Judgement and place Defendant on Post-Plea Diversion
with conditions for a period of not less than nine (9) months. Once completed the sole charge shall be dismissed.

Court reviewed the diversion agreement, defendant understands the diversion agreement. Finding of guilt withheld, approves the 9 month diversion agreement.  Bond continues.

Attorney Pierce's request to permit his client and himself to appear via Zoom video for the Plea Hearing scheduled for 7/20/22 at 1:30 p.m. approved provided the parties confirm ahead of time that they have the ability to have decent connectivity that supports video. 

I emailed Attorney Pierce this date confirming that if they have sufficient connectivity they may appear via Zoom video and I also provided Attorney Pierce with the Meeting Link & Meeting ID#. CLO

YOU MAY APPEAR EITHER IN PERSON OR BY ZOOM VIDEO UNLESS ORDERED OTHERWISE BY THE COURT.

Join Zoom Hearing by Web from your computer, tablet or smartphone:

https://wicourts.zoom.us/j/86751359154

Meeting ID: 867 5135 9154

If you have been unable to join the ZOOM meeting by the time scheduled, call 
(715) 284-0209 immediately so the court has notice and can assist you.

Plea hearing on July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for Plea hearing. Counsel will call for date.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.
3:16 PM Defendant William B. Franklin appeared by video.  Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryan I Pierce appeared by video for William B. Franklin.
Faxed Signature bond to defendant's attorney per their request for signature.
